question: What is HTML?

options.text: HTML describes the structure of a webpage
HTML is the standard markup language mainly used to create web pages
HTML consists of a set of elements that helps the browser how to view the content

description_correct: That's correct! HTML is the standard markup language mainly used to create web pages. HTML describes the structure and layout of a webpage. HTML consists of a series of elements that help the browser display content easily.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct answer is 'All of the mentioned.' HTML is the standard markup language used to create web pages, and it describes the structure of a webpage, consisting of a set of elements that help the browser display content.

question: Who is the father of HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! Timothy John Berners-Lee (TimBL) is known as the father of HTML. He is a British computer scientist, best known as the inventor of the World Wide Web.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct answer is 'Tim Berners-Lee.' He is known as the father of HTML and is best known as the inventor of the World Wide Web.

question: HTML stands for __________
description_correct: That's correct! HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct answer is 'HyperText Markup Language.'

question: What is the correct syntax of doctype in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! The correct syntax of HTML doctype is <!doctype html>. Doctype is the very first thing to write in HTML. <!doctype html> or <!DOCTYPE HTML> both are the same because the 'doctype' keyword is not case-sensitive.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct answer is '<!doctype html>'. It is the correct syntax for the doctype declaration in HTML.

question: Which of the following is used to read an HTML page and render it?
description_correct: That's correct! A web browser is used to read an HTML page and render it. It retrieves, presents, and traverses information resources on the World Wide Web.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct answer is 'Web browser.' A web browser is used to read an HTML page and render it by retrieving, presenting, and traversing information resources on the World Wide Web.

question: There are ___ levels of heading in HTML
description_correct: That's correct! There are six levels of heading in HTML.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is 'six.' HTML has six levels of heading.

question: The purpose of markup is to
description_correct: That's correct! The purpose of markup is to both add hypertext capabilities and enhance the document.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is 'both A & B.' Markup is used to add hypertext capabilities and enhance the document.

question: To get the ordered list we use
description_correct: That's correct! To get an ordered list, we use the <ol> tag.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is '<ol>'. To create an ordered list in HTML, you use the <ol> tag.

question: The Major components of the Web browser are ___
description_correct: That's correct! The major components of the Web browser include Menu Bar, ToolBar, and Location.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is 'All Of the Above.' The major components of the Web browser include Menu Bar, ToolBar, and Location.

question: Which one of the following tags is used to insert graphics in the webpage
description_correct: That's correct! The tag is used to insert graphics in a webpage.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is ''. The tag is used to insert graphics in a webpage.

question: The following HTML tag is used to display the content as a moving text
description_correct: That's correct! The <marquee> tag is used to display content as moving text.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is '<marquee>'. The <marquee> tag is used to display content as moving text.

question: HTML comment should be enclosed between
description_correct: That's correct! HTML comments should be enclosed between <!-- and -->.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is '<!-- and -->'. HTML comments should be enclosed between these delimiters.

question: For a particular font, its size attribute can be an absolute value ranging from
description_correct: That's correct! For a particular font, its size attribute can be an absolute value ranging from 1 to 10.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is '1-10.' For a particular font, its size attribute can be an absolute value ranging from 1 to 10.

question: The decimal range of network address for class B network is between
description_correct: That's correct! The decimal range of network addresses for a class B network is between 128 and 191.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is '128-191.' The decimal range of network addresses for a class B network is between 128 and 191.

question: Example of picture editing software is
description_correct: That's correct! An example of picture editing software is 'photoshop'.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is 'photoshop'. Photoshop is an example of picture editing software.

question: CD ROM stands for
description_correct: That's correct! CD ROM stands for 'compact disk read only memory'.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is 'compact disk read only memory'. CD ROM stands for 'compact disk read only memory'.

question: html document have an extension ____
description_correct: That's correct! HTML documents have an extension '.htm or .html'.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is '.htm or .html'. HTML documents have an extension '.htm or .html'.

question: The ___ element can be used to identify your HTML file to the outside world
description_correct: That's correct! title elements can be used to identify your HTML file to the outside world.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The correct answer is 'title'. title elements can be used to identify your HTML file to the outside world.

question: Which HTML tag is used to define an abbreviation or an acronym?
description_correct: Correct! The HTML tag <abbr> is used to define an abbreviation or an acronym.
description_incorrect: That's not correct. The answer is B) <abbr>, which is used to define an abbreviation or an acronym.

question: What is the correct HTML syntax of <abbr> tag?
description_correct: Exactly! The correct HTML syntax of <abbr> tag is <abbr title="abbreviation or acronym">Text</abbr>.
description_incorrect: Not quite right. The correct answer is A) <abbr title="abbreviation or acronym">Text</abbr>.

question: What HTML tag is used to define the contact information for the author/owner of a document or an article?
description_correct: Well done! The HTML tag <address> is used to define the contact information for the author/owner of a document or an article.
description_incorrect: That's not correct. The answer is C) <address>, which is used to define the contact information for the author/owner of a document or an article.

question: Which tag is used to override the current text direction?
description_correct: Great job! The HTML tag <bdo> is used to override the current text direction.
description_incorrect: Not quite right. The correct answer is B) <bdo>, which is used to override the current text direction.

question: Which HTML tag is used to define a hyperlink?
description_correct: Correct! The HTML <a> tag defines a hyperlink.
description_incorrect: That's not correct. The answer is A) <a>, which defines a hyperlink.

question: Which is the correct syntax of <a> tag?
description_correct: Exactly! The correct syntax of tag is link text.
description_incorrect: Not quite right. The correct answer is C) link text.

question: Why "href" attribute is used with <a> tag?

options.text: To define reference of a document

description_correct: Well done! The "href" attribute of the <a> tag is used to define the destination URL.
description_incorrect: Not quite right. The answer is C) To define destination URL, which is why the "href" attribute is used with <a> tag.

description_correct: Correct! The HTML tag is used to embed an image in an HTML document.

question: Which tag is used to define marked or highlighted text?
description_correct: Well done! The HTML tag <mark> is used to define marked or highlighted text.
description_incorrect: That's not correct. The answer is A) <mark>, which is used to define marked or highlighted text.

question: Which attribute specifies the path to the image?
description_correct: Correct! The src attribute specifies the path to the image.
description_incorrect: That's not correct. The answer is C) src, which specifies the path to the image.

question: Which attribute specifies an alternate text for the image?
description_correct: Well done! The alt attribute specifies an alternate text for the image.
description_incorrect: Not quite right. The correct answer is A) alt, which specifies an alternate text for the image.

question: Which HTML tag is used to define a table?
description_correct: Correct! The HTML tag <table> is used to define a table.
description_incorrect: That's not correct. The answer is A) <table>, which is used to define a table.

description_correct: Well done! Each table row is defined by a <tr> ... </tr> tag.
description_incorrect: That's not correct. The answer is B) <tr> ... </tr>, which defines each table row.

question: Each table header is defined by a ____ tag.
description_correct: Exactly! Each table header is defined by a <th> ... </th> tag.
description_incorrect: Not quite right. The correct answer is C) <th> ... </th>, which defines each table header.
